If you are at the beach or pool or in direct sunlight, it is recommended to apply 1 shot glass amount of sunscreen to the entire exposed skin. In general, the sun\u2019s rays are strongest typically around 10am to 4pm and so it is recommended to be diligent about SPF and sun protection for the face during this time of day . A helpful tip: When your shadow is shorter than you are\u2026.seek shade!","_id":"1afb6df"},{"tab_title":"Can I use regular sunscreen on my face?","tab_content":"When applying a sunscreen to your face, it is recommended to use spfs for face specifically to avoid acne breakouts and skin irritation, especially in individuals with acne-prone, oily skin. A helpful tip is to look for facial sunscreens labeled as \u201cnon comedogenic\u201d (meaning it won\u2019t block your pores) or for \u201cacne-prone\u201d skin.","_id":"09ffe79"},{"tab_title":"Should I wear sunscreen on my face every day?","tab_content":"The Skin Cancer Foundation recommends applying sunscreen every day at least 15 minutes prior to sun exposure and reapply at least every 2 hours and immediately after swimming or sweating to help decrease your risk of skin cancers and skin pre-cancers, and help prevent premature skin aging caused by the sun. Even when it\u2019s cloudy, up to 80 percent of the sun\u2019s UV radiation reaches the earth. Not protecting your skin with SPF every day, even on an overcast day, can lead to sun damage.","_id":"147bb09"},{"tab_title":"What time can I stop wearing sunscreen?","tab_content":"The sun\u2019s rays are strongest typically around 10am to 4pm all year round so it is recommended to be diligent about SPF and sun protection during this time of day. Nonetheless, when there\u2019s sunlight, there\u2019s potential for a burn \u2013 especially if you\u2019re fair-skinned and burn easily.","_id":"aaba44f"},{"tab_title":"Do face sunscreens cause acne breakouts?","tab_content":"Facial sunscreens that are labeled non-comedogenic (meaning it won\u2019t block your pores) have been tested for daily facial use in individuals with acne-prone, oily skin. With that being said, individuals with acne-prone, oily skin are often advised to test the facial sunscreen on a small area on the face prior to full facial application. We recommend our non-comedogenic Anthelios Clear Skin Oil Free Sunscreen SPF 60 for those with acne prone- and oily skin.","_id":"91f2d42"}],"title_color":"#000000","title_typography_typography":"custom","title_typography_font_weight":"600","icon_space":{"unit":"px","size":20,"sizes":[]},"__globals__":{"title_color":"globals\/colors?id=accent","icon_active_color":"","icon_color":""},"custom_css":"selector .elementor-active .elementor-accordion-icon i{\n background-color:var(--primary);\n}","_element_width_mobile":"initial","_element_custom_width_mobile":{"unit":"px","size":550,"sizes":[]}},"elements":[],"widgetType":"accordion"}],"isInner":false},{"id":"9de5d75","elType":"column","settings":{"_column_size":50,"_inline_size_tablet":100},"elements":[{"id":"76607e8","elType":"widget","settings":{"image":{"url":"https:\/\/demo2wpopal.b-cdn.net\/smartic\/wp-content\/uploads\/2023\/04\/h47_img5.jpg","id":19543,"size":"","alt":"","source":"library"},"image_size":"full","align_tablet":"left","align_mobile":"center"},"elements":[],"widgetType":"image"}],"isInner":false}],"isInner":false}]
